Package client

Class InputValidator

java.lang.Object
client.InputValidator
public class InputValidator
extends java.lang.Object
An input validator that verifies the syntactic correctness of the user input

    Constructor: build an input validator

      Parameters:
      serverIP - The entered server ip

      public java.lang.Integer isNumPlayer​(java.lang.String numPlayersString)
      Tests if the entered string is a correct num player value
      Parameters:
      numPlayersString - The entered text
      Returns:
      The null value if the string is not a correct value, otherwise its integer value

      Test if the entered string is a correct name of card
      Parameters:
      chosenCardName - The entered string
      availableNames - The set of available cards (lower cases)
      Returns:
      The selected card

    • isNicknameBetween

      public boolean isNicknameBetween​(java.lang.String choice, java.util.List<java.lang.String> availableNicknames)
      Tests if the entered string is a nickname contained in a set of string
      Parameters:
      choice - The entered string
      availableNicknames - The set of allowed nicknames
      Returns:
      True if the nickname is valid, otherwise false

    • isColorBetween

      public boolean isColorBetween​(java.lang.String choice, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> availableColors)
      Tests if the entered string is a color contained in a set of colors names
      Parameters:
      choice - The entered string
      availableColors - The set of allowed colors
      Returns:
      True if the color is valid, otherwise false

    • isValidPosition

      public Cell isValidPosition​(java.lang.String chosenPosition, java.util.List<Cell> forbiddenCells)
      Tests if the entered string is a valid position between the allowed ones
      Parameters:
      chosenPosition - The entered string
      forbiddenCells - The set of forbidden cells
      Returns:
      The cell corresponding to the chosen position if it's valid, otherwise null value
